intro: Garnotia rarotongensis, commonly known as the Cook Islands bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Cook Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat. Garnotia rarotongensis is a small shrub with narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
